title: harmony_knn
description: Cell type annotation workflow by performing harmony integration of reference and query dataset followed by KNN label transfer.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The query data in
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The query data in .h5mu format with predicted labels predicted from the classifier trained on the reference.

output_obs_predictions.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `
output_obs_predictions.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `.obs` slots to store the predicted cell labels.
If provided, must have the same length as `--reference_obs_targets`.
If empty, will default to the `reference_obs_targets` combined with the `"_pred"` suffix.

output_obs_probability.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `
output_obs_probability.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `.obs` slots to store the probability of the predictions.
If provided, must have the same length as `--reference_obs_targets`.
If empty, will default to the `reference_obs_targets` combined with the `"_probability"` suffix.

output_obsm_integrated.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_integrated_harmony`. In which .obsm slot to store the integrated embedding.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object
output_compression.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object.

id.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample
id.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input dataset consisting of the (unlabeled) query observations
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input dataset consisting of the (unlabeled) query observations. The dataset is expected to be pre-processed in the same way as --reference.

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process. Should match the modality of the --reference dataset.

input_obsm_embedding.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `X_pca`. Embedding .obsm column to use as input for integration. Should match the embedding .obsm columng of the --reference dataset.

input_obs_batch_label.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `sample`. The .obs field in the input (query) dataset containing the batch labels.

overwrite_existing_key.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If provided, will overwrite existing fields in the input dataset when data are copied during the reference alignment process
overwrite_existing_key.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If provided, will overwrite existing fields in the input dataset when data are copied during the reference alignment process.

reference.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `reference.h5mu`. Reference dataset consisting of the labeled observations to train the KNN classifier on
reference.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `reference.h5mu`. Reference dataset consisting of the labeled observations to train the KNN classifier on. The dataset is expected to be pre-processed in the same way as the --input query dataset.

reference_obs_targets.description: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `ann_level_1;ann_level_2;ann_level_3;ann_level_4;ann_level_5;ann_finest_level`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The `
reference_obs_targets.help_text: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `ann_level_1;ann_level_2;ann_level_3;ann_level_4;ann_level_5;ann_finest_level`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The `.obs` key(s) of the target labels to transfer.

reference_obs_batch_label.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `sample`. The .obs field in the reference dataset containing the batch labels.

theta.description: Type: List of `double`, default: `2.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Diversity clustering penalty parameter
theta.help_text: Type: List of `double`, default: `2.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Diversity clustering penalty parameter. Can be set as a single value for all batch observations or as multiple values, one for each observation in the batches defined by --input_obs_batch_label. theta=0 does not encourage any diversity. Larger values of theta result in more diverse clusters."

leiden_resolution.description: Type: List of `double`, default: `1.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Control the coarseness of the clustering
leiden_resolution.help_text: Type: List of `double`, default: `1.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Control the coarseness of the clustering. Higher values lead to more clusters.

weights.description: Type: `string`, default: `uniform`, choices: ``uniform`, `distance``. Weight function used in prediction
weights.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `uniform`, choices: ``uniform`, `distance``. Weight function used in prediction. Possible values are:
`uniform` (all points in each neighborhood are weighted equally) or 
`distance` (weight points by the inverse of their distance)

n_neighbors.description: Type: `integer`, default: `15`. The number of neighbors to use in k-neighbor graph structure used for fast approximate nearest neighbor search with PyNNDescent
n_neighbors.help_text:
Type: `integer`, default: `15`. The number of neighbors to use in k-neighbor graph structure used for fast approximate nearest neighbor search with PyNNDescent. 
Larger values will result in more accurate search results at the cost of computation time.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
